definition: to lean on/to rest against/to rely on/support/backing/back of a chair
Heaven Sword and Dragon Saber, wuxia (武俠|武侠[wu3 xia2], martial arts chivalry) novel by Jin Yong 金庸[Jin1 Yong1] and its screen adaptations
to lean against the railings and look at the moon (idiom)
to rely on/to be dependent on
variant of 無依無靠|无依无靠[wu2 yi1 wu2 kao4]
to have one's back against/to lean against/to be backed up by (a mountain etc)

sentences.english: I love swallow hill, spring breeze willow.
sentences.chinese: 飞燕倚我行，杨柳恋春风。

sentences.english: You lean upon a broken reed, if you trust to their compassion.
sentences.chinese: 你若是指望他们的同情，那你就等于倚在破苇杆上。

sentences.english: Paiko threw himself into the back of the Land Rover, banging his head against the hard metal.
sentences.chinese: 派克将自己扔到陆虎后车厢里，头倚着硬硬的铁皮。

sentences.english: Temple before the show and a distant relative, Reliance behind Mau Lam Xiuzhu Moonlight Hill.
sentences.chinese: 前与秀山寺遥遥相对，背后倚茂林修竹的月光山。

sentences.english: Look, there are some stone tables and stools over there. Shall we take a rest there?
sentences.chinese: 看那边有些石桌倚，我们过去休息下好吗？

sentences.english: She leaned over me and checked my air hose.
sentences.chinese: 她倚在我和我的风管检查。

sentences.english: The child lounged in an armchair.
sentences.chinese: 孩子懒洋洋地倚在扶手椅里。

sentences.english: Autumn leaned against the mountain, leaned against the roof and the trees in the spring of love tirelessly to tell the sentiment.
sentences.chinese: 秋雨倚着山，倚着屋檐及树木在娓娓诉说春恋之情。

sentences.english: Autumn leaned against the mountain, leaned against the roof and the trees in the spring of love tirelessly to tell the sentiment.
sentences.chinese: 秋雨倚着山，倚着屋檐及树木在娓娓诉说春恋之情。

sentences.english: Several students wereslouching against the wall.
sentences.chinese: 有几个学生没精打采地倚在墙上。

sentences.english: Fall upon a world title intoxicated, mediated by rain.
sentences.chinese: 秋安沉醉，嚬倚一世衔雨。

sentences.english: The dog nestled up against the warm radiator .
sentences.chinese: 狗倚着暖烘烘的散热器。

sentences.english: Women hobble about on walking frames.
I would rest my head on my hands, keeping my eyes on the road leading to the market.
sentences.chinese: 头倚在双腿坐在门前，眼睛直直的望着通往市场的路。

sentences.english: Prudence opened a window and we leaned on our elbows side by side on the balcony.
sentences.chinese: 普律当丝打开一扇窗子，我们肩并肩地倚在阳台上。

sentences.english: Half a dozen soldiers, leaning on their spears, stood on each side.
sentences.chinese: 六个十兵，倚着长矛，站在城门洞的两边。
